title: Grade 6 Assessment: Figurative Language in the Workshop

questions.skill: Explain how figurative language impacts meaning.
questions.stimulus: (1) The old workshop was his grandfather’s forbidden kingdom. (2) Liam pushed open the creaking door, a sound like a rusty hinge complaining. (3) Dust motes danced in the single beam of light, a golden ladder climbing to a high, cobwebbed window. (4) The air was thick with the ghosts of old projects—the smell of sawdust, oil, and forgotten time. (5) In the center of the room, under a dropcloth, sat a large, lumpy shadow. (6) Liam’s heart was a drum against his ribs. (7) He pulled back the cloth, and a cloud of dust erupted, a miniature gray explosion. (8) It was a machine. (9) An automaton, a clockwork man, sat slumped in a wooden chair. (10) Its metal skin was a patchwork of tarnish and rust. (11) One of its glass eyes was cracked, a spider's web of fractures. (12) Its gears were silent, its metal fingers frozen in a grasping pose. (13) "He's a broken soldier," Liam whispered, touching the cold metal. (14) He found a large brass key on the workbench. (15) His curiosity was a burning fire. (16) He fitted the key into a slot in the automaton's back and turned. (17) A *groan* of metal, a shudder, and then a faint *tick-tock-tick* began. (18) The sound was the heartbeat of a thing brought back to life. (19) The automaton’s head swiveled. (20) Its single good eye, a polished blue marble, focused on Liam. (21) Liam felt a jolt of fear, but it was quickly replaced by a wave of pure wonder. (22) The workshop, once a tomb, now felt like a stage set for magic.
questions.stem: In sentence 4, what is the meaning of the metaphor "The air was thick with the ghosts of old projects"?
options: The workshop was haunted by actual ghosts.
The workshop was messy and filled with trash.
The workshop smelled strongly of the work that used to happen there.
The workshop was dark and Liam could not see clearly.

options: The machine was used in a war and was damaged in battle.
The machine is made of strong metal, like a soldier's armor.
The machine looks damaged, abandoned, and forgotten after a long period of service.
The machine is standing at attention, waiting for orders from Liam.

questions.stem: In the last sentence, the author uses the metaphor "The workshop, once a tomb, now felt like a stage set for magic." What does this shift in metaphors reveal about the story's meaning?
options: It reveals that Liam is an actor and is pretending to be in a play.
It reveals that Liam's actions have transformed a dead, forgotten place into one of possibility and wonder.
It reveals that the workshop is dangerously unstable and the floor could collapse like a stage.
It reveals that the workshop is still a dark and frightening place, but now it is also magical.
